p:
The EV-A71 virus is enclosed by the capsid proteins VP1, VP2, VP3, and VP4
1 . VP1 shows the major antigenicity and has been defined as the neutralization determinant
1 . Based on VP1 nucleotide sequence analysis, EV-A71 can be divided into three distinct genogroups (e.g., A, B, and C)
1
,
25 . Genogroup A includes the prototype EV-A71 strain (BrCr-CA-70); this strain was first isolated in 1969 in the USA
14 , although it was not identified until 2008, in China
9 . Genogroup B can be divided into subgenogroups B1-B5, and genogroup C can be further divided into subgenogroups C1-C5
16 . Recently, the C4 genogroup was once more subdivided into the C4a and C4b lineages. Genogroup D was initially identified in India
4 , and genogroups E and F were initially identified in Africa
4 .
